newsitem.title: UK: LIFFE coffee ends off lows after sellers withdraw.
newsitem.headline: LIFFE coffee ends off lows after sellers withdraw.

text.p: Robusta coffee futures came under pressure all day but ended off lows after origin sellers retreated from falling prices, traders said.
"The general perception of the market is not very friendly," one said, referring to sentiment that further falls are likely.
But a better-than-expected performance from the New York market helped LIFFE futures to recoup some of their losses later on.
Origin sellers moved to lock in prices in early trading, but pulled back later in response to lower prices, traders said.
Part of the market's weakness was a result of the expectation that New York would fall sharply, traders said. "But in the event it held on a bit," one said.
Arabica futures were mostly firmer in rangebound dealings earely in the session, as a round of local short-covering erased early losses.
London traders were satisfied with the total LIFFE volume. "It's not too bad in recent terms," one said. "A fair amount of switch activity has boosted volume," he said. Total volume was 6,067 lots.
Front month January last traded at $1,323, down $16, having reached a low of $1,316 earlier in the day. Volume for January was 2,703 lots.
March, the most active month, last traded $20 lower at $1,272, having seen a low of $1,268. March volume was 2,772 lots.
